Refactoring the website

Contents

  • 1 FF suggestion
    • 1.1 Special help is needed for:
    • 1.2 Possible architecture
  • 2 Kruno's addition to FF suggestion
  • 3 Phil's suggestion

FF suggestion

  • Start it over with drupal (my personal choice, and with which I would know how to do the following)
  • Import all current content as pages
  • New resources:
    • User profiles - every member gets to describe herself
    • Project/node/lab pages - every member gets to describe her project/lab/space/network in a proper, wiki-like page ---> collective, self-managed project portfolio
    • Feed engine - every member can add feeds related to the bricolabs network (for instance, project weblogs, specific tags on delicious, flickr, youtube, etc.)

Special help is needed for:

  • information architecture
  • interface design

Possible architecture

  • Homepage: short description + block with aggregated feeds + online infrastructure descriptions (mailing list, irc, wiki, etc)
    • Reference
      • Homebrew
      • Paragraphs
      • Politics --- a depository of Brico-data, theory,
      • Protocols
      • Networking
      • Operating systems
      • Artisans --- Edu artisans, demystification of technology, best practices
      • Presentations / events - futuresonic, mainsdoeuvres, brasil, hosc, goodbye privacy
  • People (user profiles)
  • Projects (project pages)
  • Feed aggregator (full version)


Kruno's addition to FF suggestion

'project/lab/space/network in a proper, wiki-like page ---> collective, self-managed project portfolio' to be created as a syndicated RSS feeds instead of creating another WIKI page for each of the participant/project/...

to illustrate (this is a graph, not a design suggestion concerning colors, sizes, font type, etc. Done in inkscape - feel free to add, change):

Inkscape file to download and adjust when needed

suggestions- advocating services/archives such as: archive.org, estudiolivre.org, maybe vimeo and other similar for difference of youtube, delicious, etc; using png, using ogg, using open source font type, giving basic explanation why use VLC (etc) - lets call it 'for first-comers' (?)

Phil's suggestion

As Bricophone is a network of networks, the project page should be a network of projects with links to all of the participants/members of bricolabs to promote and show projects in the bricolabs community such as:

  • http://projects.dorkbot.org/dorkbot-wiki/DorkbotMdeWiki/unloquer/alejo
  • http://www.tmplab.org/2008/06/18/consumer-b-gone/
  • http://babelfish.yahoo.com/translate_url?doit=done&tt=url&intl=1&fr=bf-home&trurl=http%3A%2F%2Fprojects.dorkbot.org%2Fdorkbot-wiki%2FDorkbotMdeWiki%2Funloquer&lp=es_en&btnTrUrl=Translate
